data.title: Bhabendra Nath Saikia: Movies, Photos, Videos, News, Biography & Birthday
data.meta_description: Bhabendra Nath Saikia: Check out the list of all Bhabendra Nath Saikia movies along with photos, videos, biography and birthday. Also find latest Bhabendra Nath Saikia news on Times of India.
data.text:
Assam NRIs raise Rs 13L for pandemic-hit theatre artists

TNN / Dec 06, 2021, 23:07 (IST)

The artists, who had no work all these months because of lockdowns and Covid restrictions, are expected to benefit from this fundraiser.

CIFF market program unveils projects

TNN / Mar 18, 2024, 13:24 (IST)

Chandigarh’s first International film festival, Cinevesture International Film Festival announces 20 projects selected in the CIFF Market to be held from 27– 31 March 2024, on the sidelines of the festival.

Book fair on GU campus

TNN / Jan 23, 2015, 06:00 (IST)

The Post Graduate Students’ Union (PGSU) of Gauhati University (GU) will organize this year’s book fair between January 24 and January 27 on the university premises

Fiscal sops in Assam Budget to promote Assamese films

PTI / Feb 09, 2017, 18:01 (IST)

Guwahati, Feb 7 () To revive the ailing Assamese film sector, Finance Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma today proposed a slew of incentives, including 50 per cent exemption on entertainment tax, in the Budget for 2017-18.

Adil Hussain to act in Assamese film

TNN / Nov 24, 2012, 09:50 (IST)

After making the cut in Bollywood, actor Adil Hussain from Assam will play the protagonist in forthcoming Assamese film Sringkhal, which is based on a short story written by eminent Assamese playwright Bhabendra Nath Saikia.

Marathi woman to take Assamese literature to Maharashtra

TNN / Oct 23, 2013, 06:25 (IST)

At a time when Assamese youth are fast losing interest in Assamese literature and language, a Marathi woman - Vidya Sarma - has penned a translation of Assamese writer Rita Choudhury's 'Makam', which has been widely praised in Maharashtra and also has been selected for an award.

Guess who failed the Northeast quiz?

TNN / Oct 19, 2014, 03:12 (IST)

The third-year economics student of Delhi University is clearly stumped at the question. “The capital of Arunachal Pradesh?” she asks, head arched in deep concentration. “Err..Nagaland?”

75 years of Assamese cinema celebrated at Iffi

TNN / Nov 26, 2009, 06:22 (IST)

Celebrating the platinum jubilee of Assamese cinema at the ongoing 40th Iffi, an Assam government official said they have launched "cultural extremism" to counter the ULFA.

People don't get to see best of regional films: Jahnu Barua

TNN / Nov 26, 2009, 06:25 (IST)

Barua film director said it's a shame that even after so many years of Independence, and despite having such a rich and diverse culture we lack such a mechanism.

Jollywood reels under lack of theatres

TNN / Apr 21, 2012, 03:58 (IST)

As Indian feature films enter their 100th year of existence this week and Assamese films complete 85 years, we look back at the century of cinema that was, where it all began and where it stands today.
